Generation V.Black: They use their tusks to crush the berries they eat. Repeated regrowth makes their tusks strong and sharp.
Generation V.White: They mark their territory by leaving gashes in trees with their tusks. If a tusk breaks, a new one grows in quickly.
Generation V.Black 2: Its large tusks have a tendency to break, but each time they grow back, they grow in harder and sturdier.
Generation V.White 2: Its large tusks have a tendency to break, but each time they grow back, they grow in harder and sturdier.

Generation VI.X: They use their tusks to crush the berries they eat. Repeated regrowth makes their tusks strong and sharp.
Generation VI.Y: They mark their territory by leaving gashes in trees with their tusks. If a tusk breaks, a new one grows in quickly.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: They use their tusks to crush the berries they eat. Repeated regrowth makes their tusks strong and sharp.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: They mark their territory by leaving gashes in trees with their tusks. If a tusk breaks, a new one grows in quickly.

Generation VIII.Sword: These Pokémon nest in the ground and use their tusks to crush hard berries. Crushing berries is also how they test each other's strength.
Generation VIII.Shield: They play with each other by knocking their large tusks together. Their tusks break sometimes, but they grow back so quickly that it isn't a concern.

Generation IX.Scarlet: This Pokémon lives in nests that are made in the ground. People in ancient times used its tusks as cooking knives.
Generation IX.Violet: If you see peculiar teeth marks on boulders or trees, it means an Axew is likely living nearby.

Generation VIII.Sword: Axew's Eye , Route 6 , Hammerlocke Hills Rolling Fields , Axew's Eye ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Shield: Axew's Eye , Route 6 , Hammerlocke Hills Rolling Fields , Axew's Eye ( Max Raid Battle )

Generation IX.Violet: South Province: Area Five North Province: Area One , Dalizapa Passage West Province: Area One ( Ground Tera Type ) Tera Raid Battles ( 3★ )
